title: Top News Websites: The Times of Israel and Al Jazeera See Growth Amid Israel-Gaza Conflict
originSummary: The Times of Israel and Al Jazeera saw a significant increase in website visits in October, possibly as a result of the Israel-Gaza conflict.
29 out of the top 50 news websites experienced an increase in traffic during this time.
CNN, Fox News, and Daily Mail had the highest growth rates among the top 10 sites, while the BBC and The Guardian saw declines in traffic. The BBC remained the most visited news website worldwide.

title: Advanced Residential Water Data Analytics by Flume Utility & Business Solutions
originSummary: Flume Utility & Business Solutions is a company that focuses on residential water data analytics.
They use Flume Water Monitors to collect real-time data at 5-second intervals without affecting meter performance.
Flume offers services such as 24/7 leak detection, insights into specific water appliances, and the ability to analyze over 11 million gallons of residential water usage daily.

title: College Football Preview: East Carolina vs. Navy - Betting Insights on Under Bet
originSummary: The article offers an in-depth analysis of the upcoming college football game between East Carolina and Navy, using advanced metrics like Havoc, Success Rate, and Finishing Drives.
The author highlights East Carolina's strong defense and Navy's struggling offense as factors that make the under bet favorable.
It provides valuable insights and recommendations for bettors looking to place bets on the game.

title: US ecommerce sales reach $271.7B in Q3, growth remains flat
originSummary: US ecommerce sales in Q3 2023 reached $271.7 billion, growing by 7.8% compared to the previous year.
Ecommerce accounted for 21.4% of total retail sales, which amounted to $1.267 trillion.

Ecommerce growth outpaced overall retail growth and contributed to 41.0% of total retail growth for the first nine months of the year. However, Q3 showed flat growth compared to previous quarters, while offline retail sales declined. The return of Walmart to compete with Amazon Prime Day could have potentially boosted online spending.

title: BerlinRosen Holdings Hires Trisha Pascale as Head of Analytics to Optimize Marketing Impact
originSummary: Trisha Pascale has been named the first head of analytics and insights at BerlinRosen Holdings, a communications firm, with a goal of consolidating analytics functions across the company to evaluate and enhance the effectiveness of marketing and communications efforts.
Pascale intends to initially build a team of 12 members, which may grow as clients recognize the value of the analytics capabilities.
BerlinRosen Holdings plans to establish a collection of independent agencies after receiving a substantial investment from private equity firm O2 Investment Partners.

title: Big news websites in US: CNN and NYT on top as readers flock to sites covering Israel-Gaza conflict and US midterm elections
originSummary: CNN and The New York Times are still the top news websites in the US, but other sites like The Sun's US edition, Mail Online, and MSN.com have also seen a significant increase in traffic.
The Israel-Gaza conflict and the US midterm elections generated heightened reader interest, resulting in increased visits to various news websites.
Interestingly, certain right-wing and far-right sites experienced growth, while mainstream national news outlets saw a decline in traffic.

title: Open Systems Launches Secure Web Gateway as a Service for Enhanced Web Security
originSummary: Open Systems has introduced its Secure Web Gateway as a Service, a cloud-based web security solution that integrates advanced threat protection, secure access controls, and intelligent web filtering.

The service offers organizations a secure browsing experience through features such as flexible deployment options, real-time threat intelligence, content filtering and policy management, and advanced reporting and analytics.
Open Systems aims to provide a cost-effective and user-friendly solution for managing web security in today's complex environment.

title: SAS Integrates Decision Intelligence with Microsoft Fabric for Enhanced User Experience
originSummary: SAS is integrating their SAS Decision Builder into Microsoft Fabric, creating a comprehensive data and analytics platform.
The integration will allow business analysts to create composite AI workflows by combining AI models, rules, and procedural logic.
The partnership aims to improve decision automation and consistency across industries, ultimately enhancing the user experience and decision-making process.
